text:
I’m seeing a script added via require_js showing below my module’s script, making it so I can’t use functions from that required js.

This seems like a bug. My only work-arounds are to copy n paste the CDN’d file to HS, load the js in the head
seems like required js files should always load before the module js to me
<@U795QFHDE> I can answer any questions you have about the membership feature

has anyone noticed issues with permissions lately? It appears users who are assigned to teams, when creating blog posts, are automatically getting permissions applied where the post is assigned to just that team. Is this normal behavior? Just curious as this was a recent thing that happened so I wasnt sure if someone changed our permissions or not

Yup, so it looks like when a user creates a post, whatever team they are assigned to is autochecked in the "Assign Users and Teams" for that blog post. This means normal Editors that are in the system who are not apart of that team, cannot see the posts
For example, we have an editor here who has all permissions in the marketing tab in her account, because she is not on the same "team" as one of the developers here who wrote a blog she can't see it
even though her permissions are set to read/write/publish on all blogs
Seems like a bug on this
As the only way our Editor can do this would be to be apart of the "Dev" team or a superadmin, none of which we really want as the editor mainly only does front end stuff, never DM side stuff
Hey <@U2H3TT8F2> I alerted the PM who owns this, trying to get him in here for a direct conversation

Thanks Zack! from what I can think of, I mean I suppose I could create a group called: `Blog Writers` assign everyone there and then assign the others to other teams, but it just seems like way to many teams to do this lol
:wave: hey <@U2H3TT8F2>. we did make some changes with permissions last week. Check out this blog post for all the details. Happy to DM if you have any specific questions
<https://www.HubSpot.com/product-updates/changes-coming-to-content-partitioning>
omg hahah this is the right way of offering a free service :joy:
I’ve been seeing horizontal spacers showing up on my page editor - even though they are disabled for content editing. Anyone else been experiencing that?
maybe they weren’t disabled before the page with that template was crreated?
maybe -
i’ll try
if it disabled for content editing, i believe the module still shows, it just doesnt let you edit any options in the module
I don’t think that’s actually the case
pretty confident it normally just doesn’t show the module in edit modules, and if the user hovers it it shows as locked
yeah I had mine locked and for some reason they were still showing
I’m going to try it again -

Is there a reason why a custom module with a rich text module in it thats being used in the drag and drop editor can’t accept a image tag within it? This seems alittle weird. Our team uses Vidyard and they use the email embed (consisting of a image and link). Which means the drag and drop has no easy of of adding something like that in.

<@U7AU6414J> What does the embed text look like that you're trying to add? There is an option to add an image when using the rich text module but it is separate from the code. Does your embed link have the image and video all wrapped up in whatever code Vidyard gives you? Maybe you can instead paste the full snippet into the embed option of the module and then choose the code tab instead of just the URL?
Does anyone know why when I try to preview my test portal, I am getting this:

Error 1015 Ray ID: XXXXXXXXXXXX • 2019-02-25 22:14:50 UTC
You are being rate limited
What happened?
The owner of this website (mysite) has banned you temporarily from accessing this website.
Did you use any testing software on the site recently?
<@U26DA9CQ0> not that I am aware of, it eventually came back but this was the first time I ever saw this before, hopefully it was a one time thing
